data.name: Warhammer 40,000: Battle Sister
data.description:
New co-op Horde multiplayer mode, supported by regular content and feature updates now available!

Join the fight and experience the ultimate in visceral and immersive futuristic combat.

This all-action shooter arms you with a range of super-powerful weapons and abilities with which to crush your foes. Dive into a gripping, action-filled story spanning the galaxy and battle against the hideous forces of Chaos who threaten the future of humanity

- Explore vast planetary installations, huge derelict space vessels & ancient expansive ruins, in VR for the first time.

- High octane, intense shooter action, face hordes of formidable foes from the dark forces of Chaos.

- Wield 12 incredible and powerful weapons including Chainswords, Plasma Pistols, Boltguns, Flamers, Grenades and Power Swords

- Throw, catch, pass, dodge, free move and dual wield - 

- Massive bosses and epic moments

- Enhanced Quest 2 visuals, dynamic shadows and reflections

1.2.4 Patch Notes 

A new update for Battle Sister with bug fixes and NEW voice activation!
Let's take look ğŸ‘‡

Bug fixes:

Multiplayer: an issue where held ladders would respawn with players has been fixed 
Multiplayer: an issue where held weapons seen in the ending results screen has been fixed 

Voice Activation:

This option can be activated in the settings menu, either on the main menu or in-game. An internet connection is required in order to use this option correctly. If this option is turned on, there will be additional tutorial messages in the chapters where Acts of Faith are obtained. These also mention the words or phrases you can use to activate Acts of Faith with your voice. 

In addition, the normal gestures for activation of Acts of Faith can still be used; voice activation is an additional way to activate these abilities. 

For those players who have already played past these chapters, the words to use are: 
Pushback - Say â€œDie Heretics!â€ or â€œPushâ€ while holding down the faith button to voice activate force power.
Slow Down - Say â€œFor the Emperor!â€ or â€œStopâ€ while holding down the faith button to voice activate the slowdown power.
Shield - Say â€œEmperor Protects!â€ or â€œShieldâ€ while holding down the faith button to voice activate the shield power.

Please note, currently, this feature only accepts saying the words in English. Also, the player will need to hold the Act of Faith button until the requested power activates, as there is a slight delay until the Emperor answers your prayers!

1.2.3 Patch notes:


A brand new update is here for Battle Sister. Letâ€™s dive in!

Noteworthy bug fixes:

MP: A bug was fixed where the end screen did not show if a player had left the game
MP: A blocker for the last wave in Cathedrum and Refinery has been fixed
MP: An issue with the lobby was fixed where disconnecting players were not removed from the instance.
Updates to Multiplayer matchmaking to support cross-play with Steam.

The Big Guns Content update for Last Bastion mode is here featuring:

- Three new Enemies:
- Heavy Bolter Marine
- Plasma Pistol Raptor
- Grenade Launcher Cultist
- Three new Player Weapons for Online Multiplayer
- Grenades
- Grenade Launcher
- Plasma Pistol
- Difficulty rebalance
- Last Bastion Rebalanced: The waves for all maps now feature the new enemy types.

Changes to Campaigns:
- We went through all campaign levels and gave each level a polish pass to improve performance and user experience.

Technical Update:
- You can now switch co-op regions! Play multiplayer with users all over the world.
- Weâ€™ve made animation set-up changes for improved performance.
- Improved handling and VFX for the Grenade Launcher 
- Improved colliders for weapons and enemies.
- Improved collision with player weapons.
- Improve user experience: Empty magazines can no longer be picked up and instead disappear. 
- Improved user experience flow of Oculus Invites.

Bug fixes:
- Fixed broken spawn groups improve gameplay and performance.
- Enemies are now less likely to lose track of the player and get stuck.
- Fixed a bug that led to a dead-end on the result screen after multiple games in a row.
- Fixed a bug where users lost holstered weapons after respawning.
- Fixed a bug where the map selection would display the wrong icon.
- Fixed a bug where the shop buttons became greyed out after initial use. It should now be clearer which weapons are available and which are not.
- Fixed a bug that led to interruptions in the score screen of Last Bastion. 
- Fixed a bug that kept the user on a grey screen and required a restart.
- Fixed bugs with the Multiplayer Menu UI.
- Fixed an issue with the score on the results screen not awarding the User points for completing the game.
- Fixed invisible projectiles from enemies on the RIFT version of the Game.
- Fixed an issue where Autogun cultist bullets were using Bolter VFX on collision.
- Fixed a bug in the Heart of Dread results screen where the User could see outside the map.

Known Issue:


- Weâ€™re aware of an issue where attempting to grab a magazine dropped by another player in multiplayer may lock up the hand you are trying to grab with. If you experience this, to clear the lock, you need to grab another item, such as a grenade or weapon in your other hand. We recommend you stick to the ammo vacuum effect to collect magazines in the meantime.
- We are aware of a bug where manually reloading weapons can cause the second player in multiplayer to lose grip on a held item.

Thanks again for your incredible support through our first year on the Oculus store. We hope you enjoy our latest update.

Connect with other players and the team on our Discord community at Pixeltoys.com/community
Issues affecting the Multiplayer 'Last Bastion' horde mode are now resolved.

Patch Notes:

Gameplay:
Single Player: We have adjusted the difficulty for Chapters 1-4 to smooth out the difficulty spikes we saw in player data. We will monitor the development and work on further adjustments if necessary. 
Multiplayer: You can now hot-join multiplayer games. This means if there are active games running you can dive in and out of the sessions to support your fellow players without being dependent on open lobbies.
General: We updated the sound effects for enemies in general. It is now more obvious when an enemy is behind you.
Audio: We updated multiple audio files and triggers to improve sound quality. As an example weapons shot from distance should now sound more believable. 

Bug Fixes:
Multiplayer: We fixed a rare bug that locked players in a death loop if they played more than 4 games in a row.
Multiplayer: We fix a hang in the menu when you switched between different modes
Multiplayer: We fixed a bug where sometimes player A was rewarded coins when player B killed an enemy
Rift, Audio: Fixed unwanted pausing of audio when you removed the headset

- We fixed the refinery map allowing players to pass wave 6
- Small balance change to reduce the accuracy of enemies in multiplayer

Patch Notes:

Gameplay:
Multiplayer: Reworked network code for hit detection in MP. Hitting enemies should now be more accurate and natural.
Multiplayer: Each map now has its own music
Multiplayer: Reworked the player area in the Outpost map so that you have more cover points and spaces to move.
Multiplayer/Coop: We added a UI message when your coop buddy dies. 

Bug Fixes:
Rift: We fixed a bug where a user could lose their save games when switching from Quest to Rift
Rift: We fixed a bug that caused the flamer to have no sound effect
Rift/Multiplayer: We fixed a bug that stopped voice chat from using the right audio channel
Multiplayer: We fixed a bug where users did not receive XP if they skipped the animation on the end screen
Multiplayer: We fixed a bug with magazines sometimes floating in the air
Multiplayer: We fixed a bug with the Bolt Pistol when you tried to hold it with two hands
General audio and visual bug fixes

Patch Notes:

NEW:
Heart of Dread Horde Map
Now available on Rift with cross-play and cross-buy enabled!

Gameplay:
We increased the amounts of coins you get in 2 player games.
We adjusted enemy accuracy and will monitor feedback from the community

Bug Fixes:
Damage calculation in multiplayer games is now more consistent and reliable
Payer avatars are now hidden when not needed (e.g. end of the round scoreboard)
Inventory slots get no longer blocked when weapons with empty magazines get stored
Buy Max ammo button now considers the available space in the ammo pouch correctly
Double flamer should now have the correct flame behaviour
We fixed an issue that caused melee enemies to sometimes get stuck in place
We fixed a bug where enemies instantly died when they appeared
Outpost specific: We fixed a pathing issue where enemies could get stuck behind certain terrain objects.
Minor UI glitch fixes.

Patch Notes:

Maintenance mode has been lifted on Multiplayer mode!

Gameplay:

- Coop is now available in early access!
- Play with one of your friends in our Last Bastion mode and see how well you can tag team the hordes of Chaos.
- Use either quick play to look for a game or create a private lobby and invite a friend to play with you. 
- You can use the ingame VOIP system to communicate.
- We updated the leaderboards to reflect the new maps & co-op additions to Last Bastion!
- We added two new maps : Outpost Trisus and Olzalyn Refinery

Outpost Trisus: 
- Fight in the outskirts of an imperial outpost and hold your ground. 
- Enjoy the fantastic scale of the 41st Millennium where even small outposts have skyscraping defences. 
- Enjoy long-range firefight and a way larger area for enemies to move in. 
- Also now available in solo mode!

Olzalyn Refinery:
Hold out your last stand on an old bridge right on the verge of a workers town, an old mining place and an abandoned imperial refinery. 
Take the challenge of a multi-levelled player area and keep your eyes peeled for attacks from multiple directions in this deadly night fight. 
Also now available in solo mode!


Bug Fixes:
We removed explosives from the Last Bastion mode as they had unwanted side effects. We will be giving them a new lick of paint, refactoring and re-releasing them at a later date!

1.2.4 Patch Notes 

A new update for Battle Sister with bug fixes and NEW voice activation!
Let's take look ğŸ‘‡

Bug fixes:

Multiplayer: an issue where held ladders would respawn with players has been fixed 
Multiplayer: an issue where held weapons seen in the ending results screen has been fixed 

Voice Activation:

This option can be activated in the settings menu, either on the main menu or in-game. An internet connection is required in order to use this option correctly. If this option is turned on, there will be additional tutorial messages in the chapters where Acts of Faith are obtained. These also mention the words or phrases you can use to activate Acts of Faith with your voice. 

In addition, the normal gestures for activation of Acts of Faith can still be used; voice activation is an additional way to activate these abilities. 

For those players who have already played past these chapters, the words to use are: 
Pushback - Say â€œDie Heretics!â€ or â€œPushâ€ while holding down the faith button to voice activate force power.
Slow Down - Say â€œFor the Emperor!â€ or â€œStopâ€ while holding down the faith button to voice activate the slowdown power.
Shield - Say â€œEmperor Protects!â€ or â€œStopâ€ while holding down the faith button to voice activate the shield power.

Please note, currently, this feature only accepts saying the words in English. Also, the player will need to hold the Act of Faith button until the requested power activates, as there is a slight delay until the Emperor answers your prayers!

An overview of changes in this update can be found below:

Controls:

New controls menu option added to change the sensitivity of primary stick teleport. Helping to reduce accidental teleporting whilst turning.
Added additional reminders that centering your view will recalibrate your height

Gameplay:

We have modified the following gameplay functions to make the game more challenging:

The player max health was reduced
The health regeneration delay was increased
The amount of health gained through regeneration was increased
Ammunition values and placement rebalanced throughout all levels

We have reworked enemy encounters in the following areas to smooth out gameplay:

Chapter 3, target selection and pathing after obtaining the Lasgun.
Chapter 3, the initial defence of the last bunker
Chapter 7, the bloodletter summoning room after the two blast doors
Chapter 7, the corridor to the final hangar

Added additional signposting for the airlock puzzle in Chapter 6 so players are better informed on how to proceed.
Faith indicators on your wrist have been updated and should now be more clear and intuitive.
Faith Push now more effective at pushing enemies/terrain

Graphics updates:
Quest 2: Anisotropic filtering enabled on textures to retain crispness
Quest 2: Dynamic frame buffer to increase the resolution 

Audio:
Audio: new voice line for epic shots added
Audio: new voice lines for Sir Conrad
Audio: Bolter sound levels and clarity improved
Audio: Clarity across all weapons improved
Audio: Music now plays on chapter loading screens

Bug Fixes:
Removed some additional collisions to stop bullets hitting invisible walls
NPC should now no longer jitter when they look at the player
Enemy pathing now checks if other enemies are on the way to their destination
The Lasgun should now be more reliable at close range
The Imperial Knight should no longer constantly fire when the player is escorting him in Chapter 9
Chaos Marines should no longer suddenly stop shooting the player mid-fight
Rot flies now move around more and are more dangerous
Warp Talons and Raptors should now run properly and be more accurate at mid-range
Height calibration should now properly support up to 2m height
Fixed a couple of misaligned doors in Chapter 3 and 4
Act of Faith: the user can no longer activate buttons with faith push
A flickering in the movement vignette was fixed
Enemy ragdolls now look more realistic and travel further

Patch 1 Release Notes:

Controls:

Smooth Turning Added - We have added a smooth turning mode for those who prefer this style. This is available via the comfort section of the settings menu.

Gameplay:

Grenade Launcher - The grenade launcher projectiles now explode on contact with enemies rather than bouncing. 

Chapter 9 Boss Storm Bolters - Two of the Storm Bolters had inconsistent behaviours, this has been rectified to make this encounter more enjoyable.

Power Sword - The Power Sword itself now glows with dangerous power

Chapter 10 Enemies - The visuals of the enemies in Chapter 10 have been improved along with tweaks to their AI to increase their intelligence.

Chapter 7 Boss - logic, visual effect and animation improvements to this boss encounter to make it more lethal and challenging.

Chapter 2 Window - a shiny new window looking out to Belis Retani beyond.

Chapter 6 Puzzle Refinement - improvements to the puzzles in Chapter 6 that help to signpost gameplay and readability.

Score Tracking and Balancing - Inconsistencies between score tracking in campaign mode and level replay have been removed. As a consequence of this, we need to reset leaderboards to ensure a level playing field for those chasing top scores, we apologise for the inconvenience of this.

Bug Fixes:

Environment Streaming Tweaks - to remove some environment pop in occurring.

General Stability Improvements - a series of bug fixes and improvements to increase overall game stability. This includes visual fixes, nav mesh fixes for stuck enemies and minor bugs found by the community.

We will continue to refine and update the experience of Battle Sister based on community feedback and reports in future updates. We would like to say a huge thank you to everyone who has shared their feedback with us so far. 

Happy Holidays from the Pixel Toys team!
